message.content:
cs.AI, cs.PL, cs.CE, cs.DS, cs.SE. 

The paper presents a new application of logic programming to a real-life problem in hydraulic engineering, specifically dealing with the valve isolation system design in a water distribution network. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, as it involves the use of Constraint Logic Programming to solve a hard combinatorial problem. Additionally, the paper mentions the possibility of other areas of logic programming, such as Answer Set Programming, being useful in the field of hydroinformatics, which further supports the likelihood of it belonging to the cs.PL (Programming Languages) sub-category. The paper also involves collaboration between computer scientists and hydraulic engineers, indicating that it may be relevant to the Computer Engineering (cs.CE) sub-category. The use of constraint propagation to obtain better solutions suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with one aspect of the design of a water distribution network, which suggests that it may be relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
